title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart (Pittsburgh, PA)
Interview Descriptions: Very easy, takes place on zoom, they asked what I would do in some scenarios with kids. Easy-going. They interviewed many candidates and hired most of them from what I understand.
Interview Questions: What would you do to resolve a disagreement between two children?

title: Retail Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart (Wonderboom)
Interview Descriptions: it was so easy there where 2 interviewers and it was a 1 on 1 interview the questions that where asked they were so easy and the people were so friendly
Interview Questions: tell us about your self

title: Crew Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Questions related to jumpstart. Was around 30 minutes and felt more like a conversation than a strict interview. Gave senerio like questions that connected with students. It was not too bad.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you took a leadership role?

title: Group Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quick and questions were pretty simple . Did a brief demo for the interview and it went by very quickly and it was a breeze if I’m being honest
Interview Questions: What would you do in a situation like?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions:
Very friendly and supportive. Helped me better understand the roles available and test my own suitability along the way. 
I met both founders during the process and they made me feel really at ease.
Interview Questions: A ppt based study with a company they work with

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Jumpstart in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: Intro, presentation, unseen case study, personal questions and your own questions. The interview itself is well structured, however, time limits prevent you from being too detailed - something I was told I lacked in the last slide of my presentation. Their personal questions were a bit vague, especially with motivations, be sure to talk enthusiastically about the position, even if you do not know which one you want to apply for.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work with a start-up?
What are your motivations?

title: Jumpstart Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: There were many questions about how to handle particular situations with students. You work in teams so collaboration and teamwork is key! I used my background in psychology to answer many of these questions.
Interview Questions: Why I am motivated to do this role

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Jumpstart in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions:
1. Received an email with scheduling an interview online.
2. 1 hour panel interview, including tasks and questions.
During one hour interview we were divided into groups and everyone was answering the same questions. After 45 minutes we came back to the main room and there was time for questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Team Partner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Very clean and efficient, asked us questions about our interests in childhood education and what we thought was most important in teaching to children, how the current state of education policies are, etc.
Interview Questions: What do you think is most important when teaching a diverse classroom?

title: Associate Director of Alumni Communication Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Multiple interviews with various people at different levels. Everyone was very friendly and kind/interested in learning about your background and the “why.” Dress formal even though their dress code is more relaxed.
Interview Questions: Jumpstart culture/values are very important

title: Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Really easygoing and easy to apply hired that weekend and the supervisors were great to work with the children also make you excited to come back to work everyday aidhakbdka
Interview Questions: What would you do in a situation with a child needing help understanding a word

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Easy interview and nice people to talk to. Asked about my experience and my future plans. No tough questions or unexpected questions that I hadn’t planned for. Typical interview questions.
Interview Questions: What are your future plans

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: A few rounds of interviews with different people, starting with a 30 min phone screen. The phone screen was basic questions. The other interviews were focused on my experience and skills. Last interview included the hiring manager who would be my supervisor.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when someone wasn't achieving their responsibilities in a group or team you were a part of or managed. How did you handle it?

title: Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: They are looking for people who truly care about the work this organization does the interview is fairly simple as long as you shall positivity motivation and passion towards serving children in low income areas
Interview Questions: Why do you wanna work for this organization? Tell me about a time you were in a leading position and had to handle conflict?

title: Graduate Program Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Pre-prepared 15 presentation on a topic of the choice, usually how to sell one of the products their companies offer. In my case, it was about an app for group life insurance. The challenge being how to make a product employers don't want to buy attractive. It was a one to one interview with one of the Jumpstart organisers. The atmosphere was quite casual and the interviewer very kind. They did not create an atmosphere of pressure or intimidation.
Interview Questions: What is one entrepreneurial thing I have done in the past

title: Graduate Scheme Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: General competency questions, logic problems and data analysis task. The interview lasted an hour.  The application process is easy compare to other grad schemes. Applied in Jan and had interview in late Feb.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you demonstrate proactivity

title: Digital Marketing Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was contacted for a phone screen.  First question asked on phone screen was, "Tell me why we should hire you." (red flag  to me) All questions were read of a script and the interview was not conversational at all. None of my clarifying questions could be answered and I was not invited to ask any of my own.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Technical Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Jumpstart in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions: The review process consisted of a call with the recruiter, followed by three one hour panels before getting a formal job offer. Everything was done via Teams because of Covid-19 and it made it possible to take the calls at various times of the day from wherever I happened to be.
Interview Questions: Tell us about how you've made your work environment a more inclusive environment.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: I got an email to set up a phone interview. For the phone interview, we talked for about 30 minutes. It took the company 2 months to get back to me about not getting the job. I had already moved on by then. The interviewer was unsure in their answers to questions I had asked pertaining to growth in the company and understanding the role. People in leadership had left and sites were starting with new teams.
Interview Questions:
Have you ever had a conflict with a team member? If so, how did you resolve the conflict?
How do you keep yourself organized?

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Get to know your future interests, why you want to work with kids, past courses, and future goals. Work-study vs Volunteer, hypothetical scenarios regarding speaking to parents about child's development and how to encourage children.
Interview Questions: A child doesn't like to practice saying letters and words. Only enjoys the sandbox and blocks, how do you make this interesting for the child and practice those things?

title: Paralegal Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions:
A pretty easy interview based on questions about you mostly.  The interviewer was also very nice. 

I would suggest being yourself and maintaining a positive attitude. They want to see that you have the patience and positivity to work with kids.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with kids?

title: Corp Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Los Angeles, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: I sat through an interview with one of the site managers just going through my experience with children and what I was hoping ti get out the experience. I also had to do a reading demonstration which was a bit nerve wracking, but went well. They will help you improve.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have working with children ages 3-6?

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: I had a group interview. it was okay, you just talk about the kind of experiences you had with the kids and they would ask situation based questions. I was offered the position the next day
Interview Questions: what is your experience working with kids?

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: I was called for an interview within a week. The interview was pretty standard. Asked me about my experience working with children in the past, my volunteering experiences. At the end of the interview, asked gave scenarios involving children and was asked how I would handle those situations
Interview Questions: What are three qualities you need when interacting with children?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: It went great live the interview and it was all I thought it would be and more I was really glad I went to talk to them I would love to work with themit was nice to be a found happy people please just enjoy through questions
Interview Questions: How tall are you

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: One round of interviews. Pretty easy and just testing your ability to work with kids. It is a flexible job and mostly communication skills are needed. Showing interest during the interview helps.
Interview Questions: How do you normally handle challenges?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jumpstart in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was great! They really just want to get to know you personally. The interviewee was not trying to trick me with the questions. I’d say definitely know how to speak about the different roles on your resume!
Interview Questions: Why are you interested In this position?

title: Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Boston, MA)
Interview Descriptions: It was good. I had originally applied for another role and HR reached out with an opportunity that matched my  resume that I appreciated and we had a good conversation about skills, the role and if I wanted to move forward.
Interview Questions: How work in teams

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Pittsburgh, PA) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview where you had to work with a group and discuss different scenarios and create a conclusion. Everyone was super nice and they got back to us within. week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with children?

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Group interview was conducted, where we were asked to answer specific questions, as well as worked together to complete group activities. Overall the process was good and really focused on working together as a group, as the job is very collaborative with other team members.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Two round of interview, first you get a call. He will ask you about yourself, education experience, why you wanted to switch. Then he will invite you for a one to one session. On his recommendation you will get a call for final interview by the CEO.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your Childhood

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Philadelphia, PA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume and received an interview with a site manager. He asked me a few questions. Probably took around 30 minutes. He asked what my schedule looked like, if I had a car, etc. After my interview, I was contacted a week or so later and received an offer.
Interview Questions: What I would do in specific scenarios with kids in the classroom. When have my values conflicted with my job. What experience with children and teaching have I had.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Jumpstart (New York, NY) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of one batch of interviews with both the local volunteer coordinator and the state coordinator. It touched on my interests in childhood development, language skills, previous experience, etc. It seemed to be important to both interviewers that I was a good fit personally/culturally.
Interview Questions: If I had previous experience working with pre-k/kindergarten aged children.

title: Team Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Ask about history with working with children/relevant experiences in early learning. Interviewed with another candidate and one site supervisor/manager. Also did a partner team building exercise where we had to complete a puzzle together. Also asked about languages spoken and availability/scheduling.
Interview Questions: What are your experiences working with kids?

title: Site Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Started with a phone screen followed by two in - person interviews. Standard interview process where I met with two members of the management team. I was received an interview process rather quickly and the whole process only took a month.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Jumpstart?

title: Jumpstart Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: It was a typical interview, that was not too difficult but also not too easy. You are asked why you are interested in the program and what you can bring to it, as well as your greater interest in decreasing the childhood education gap. Then you are given some classroom scenarios which you are asked how you would tackle.
Interview Questions: How did you find this position and why are you interested in it?

title: Jumpstart Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Irvine, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was really easygoing. They ask you many questions that relates to how passionate you are about education. They also give you a few scenario questions relating to classroom and behavior management.
Interview Questions: What would you do if two kids started fighting? Why do you want to work for us? Do you agree with our mission?

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Jumpstart (New York, NY) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a group interview with one interviewer and three interviewees. The interviewer asked us each the same questions. It was very casual and the interviewer was very nice. One interviewee came in pretty late so we started ahead. When she arrived, the interviewer was kind and we just continued with the interview.
Interview Questions:
Talk about your experience with kids.
Talk about your experience with community service.
Talk about your experience in a diverse setting.
What qualities are important to have when dealing with kids these young?

title: Site Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Jumpstart (New York, NY) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: I recently interviewed over the phone with the region hiring person for the site manager position. The interview was not difficult. Questions were typical interview questions. I was asked to give an overview of my resume, and discuss some experiences working with college students. I was also asked to talk about challenges of working with that population. Over all the interview process took about half hour. I did not get the job but they were really good about quickly getting back to me to let me know they were going with someone else. Communication remained open.
Interview Questions: What are some challenges of working with college students.

title: Development Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Boston, MA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Initial online application, was emailed to set up phone interview, followed up with in person interview. There was a two-week period prior to hearing anything back, which is standard for most online applications.
Interview Questions: How well do you do with support tasks such as taking notes during meetings?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Applied through sending resume and cover letter over email. Set up interview over email. Interview was only one conversation over the phone with supervisor. Offer for internship was made later in the week by supervisor.
Interview Questions: What do you know about Jumpstart?

title: Jumpstart Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Jumpstart (New York, NY) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview went pretty well. It lasted around 30mins or so. Questions were normal, nothing particularly hard, or weird. Questions were mostly asked about past experiences and how would you teach/deal with kids in classrooms. Someone hypothetical scenario questions were asked also. The interviewer was really nice.
Interview Questions: Nothing particularly hard or weird just the questions that are asked on the application form

title: Jumpstart Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: I filled out an application online on Jumpstart website. I had an on campus interview the next week. It was a very laid back interview. Received an email a few days later saying I got into the program.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for us?

title: Jumpstart Site Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Jumpstart (New York, NY) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Received invitation for interview approximately three weeks after submitting application online. Conducted 20 minute phone interview. Interviewer was very engaging and provided immediate feedback. They also provided feedback on culture of organization. Interviewer encouraged responses and was very friendly. Provided many opportunities for candidate to ask questions; and gave excellent, detailed, answers to every question.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for Jumpstart? How do you prioritize tasks?

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Ann Arbor, MI)
Interview Descriptions: Short interview with basic questions about my experience with education, my thoughts on education and why I agree/disagree with the mission statement of americorps. I applied online and inmediately was contacted for a in-person 1:1 interview with the chapter supervisor. The interview was informal, comfortable and fairly easy
Interview Questions: What do you hope to gain?

title: Corp Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: It is very simple. you just apply and they send you an email. If you do not respond to the email they call to follow up on your scheduling of the interview. For the interview you have to take a tb test, ID, and birth certificate or passport. IF you do not have your tb test, it is okay, you just have to get it before you go into the classroom, which will be about a month after the interview.
Interview Questions:
asked about experiences with children and diversity
asked about what kind of difference you want to make in the community

title: Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Very comfortable process, given info about position, asked how I would handle a coworker being on their cell phone in a meeting, salary given, ended, heard back about position a couple weeks later
Interview Questions: What would you do if you noticed a worker on their cell phone during a team meeting?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Applications process was to send in a résumé along with a cover letter. I then received an email asking for a brief phone interview. The ladies that spoke to me were very professional and kind. The phone interview lasted for 30 minutes. A couple hours later they emailed me for an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: What made you apply to this job

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: The online application is lengthy and requires a lot of detail. Best to have past experience working with children either by some kind of volunteer work or community service. The application is pretty simple and straightforward, just answer honestly and make sure you sound ardent about what you do.
Interview Questions: Straight forward questions about working with children and in a group with other member and what would you do in certain situation. Pretty much questions similar to what was asked in the online application.

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Jumpstart (New York, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Half an hour phone interview. The lady who interviewed me was extremely warm and friendly, and the process was not intimidating at all. Felt more like I was chatting with a friend, which was really nice. I had been asked to submit a long application form (that had many questions) before the phone interview, and she asked questions based on what I had written on my form. I was offered the position at the end of the phone call.
Interview Questions: How would you manage your time with all the commitments you already have with school?

title: Jumpstart Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: personal, don't feel scared or timid. talk about real life scenarios. would ask what would you do if this happened. got you thinking about future and current goals and how this could help you. more then just a job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Los Angeles, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Fairly simple: I applied online through my university.  I received a call a few days later and did a brief phone screen.  Then, I came in for a 1-on-1 interview and got the job a few days later.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult client.

title: Jumpstart Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: First, I submitted a very detailed application and corresponding 'essay' type questions, which took a few hours to be able to really sit down and properly work through. The interview was one-on-one and very straightforward. The questions were aimed at gleaning information about your skills and strengths. This position is for college students who may not have much professional experience, but who likely might have had a chance to lead a group or volunteer.
Interview Questions: No tough questions - just know your skill set and past experiences well so that you can explain how you would apply what you know to the position. Also, do some research into the position and perhaps the national discourse on education, reform, etc.

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Basic Questions
Interview Questions: it was not difficult

title: Jumpstart Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Chicago, IL) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: The Site Manager emailed me to set up a time to interview after I completed the online application.  Basically, it is a screening to see if you have thought at all about how to work with 3-5 year olds and if you can physically and emotionally handle the work.  It is an opportunity for you to talk about why you are a good fit for the position, but at the same time realize that they are hiring dozens of people, so as long as you come across basically competent and interested in the position, you should be good.  That said, you are working with little humans!  You should want to spend time with them if you are following through on this job.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your experience with 3-5 year olds.

title: Jumpstart Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Jumpstart in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I received an email from a Jumpstart site manager from my university inviting me to apply to become a corps member. I promptly completed the questionnaire. Few days later, they asked when I could come in for an interview. In the interview there were three other applicants. We were all asked the same questions. Site manager alternated the order in which she asked the questions. We were asked to implement a section of a sample lesson plan as a team. We also read from one of the books used during the year. Be enthusiastic and demonstrate you care!
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult children?

title: Jumpstart Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: The interview went well because my interviewer was very nice and professional. I was asked a number of questions off of a sheet. There were a lot of questions where I was given a scenario and asked what I would do in that situation to achieve a certain goal. The questions seem like more of a preparation for you to understand what you need to do on the job and also to help them learn about you to match you to a child. Basically, it seems like everyone that applies gets hired.  I think I was offered a job right at the end of the interview (can't quite remember).
Interview Questions:
How would you bring literacy to the block area?

Your team members are off task and distracted. How would you get their attention and get them back on task?

title: Jumpstart Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: It's an one on one interview and they ask basic questions about your past experiences and your experiences with teaching children.
Interview Questions: What would you do if your group members did not follow directions?

title: Team Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Columbia, MO) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
quick and laid back
I went into the office and a site manager interviewed me, and another site manager came in for one part of the interview. It lasted 2-3 hours but was mostly conversation and very informal.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you saw a team member on their cell phone?

title: Jumpstart Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Simply I applied to be a JumpStart corp member and I received a call a week later. They started with a phone screening asking about career interest reasons for applying and so forth
Interview Questions: How are you planning to impact the life of a child in a positive way?

title: Full Time AmeriCorps Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Jumpstart
Interview Descriptions: Basic questions on why you want to be there and past work related to public service.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Columbia, MO) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: The process was easy and short. They were very nice and made you feel comfortable. I enjoyed how relaxed they were and the questions weren't too difficult. The interview lasted roughly 20 minutes and I was finished. I was informed immediately that I was offered the position. I happily accepted the offer and was told about a 6 week training staring within the next school year. The training was paid and the site mangers were very warm and informative. I loved my experience with the company!
Interview Questions: Have you worked with children before?

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Philadelphia, PA) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: Questions were based on handling certain situations in a classroom while working with children under the age of 5. They also involved questions about emergency situations that might arise. Many of the questions were directed towards the importance of early literacy. I was also asked personal questions such as what skill sets I had that would make me a good fit for the job, prior experience with children, willingness to commit, etc.
Interview Questions: A 3-year-old is struggling to learn how to spell his/her name, and you know that one of their favorite activities is playing with blocks. How can you help them?

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Pittsburgh, PA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: I emailed the representative for the university, she contacted me back and told me to complete the online application in which I did. A few days later I was called in for an in person interview.  She was very nice and calming. The interview room was in the individual prep room with had tons of arts and crafts so It lightened the situation a bit. The site managers were fairly young and light hearted.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a disruptive or problem child.

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Jumpstart (Chicago, IL) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: It was one of the most unique interviews I'd ever been in. They don't interrogate you across the room like most interviewers. They have crayons and markers and posterboards and pipe cleaners laid out all across the table. They ask you to draw pictures and think of scenarios and design activities.
Interview Questions: Don't remember. The best thing to do is focus everything back to the benefit of the child or children. It was all basic interview questions, just catered toward playing with and being around children.

title: Corps Member Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Jumpstart in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: very quick, basic interview. asked simple questions about work history and walked me through my resume. she also had me answer some case questions, but they were nothing you could prepare for. very straightforward and common sense.
Interview Questions: what is a challenge you might face?
